cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River (325 miles SE of Houma, Louisiana)
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the central Gulf toward southeast Louisiana, then turning north across Louisiana and western Mississippi before curving northeast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon/Grand Isle

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River eastward to the Alabama/Florida border (includes entire Mississippi coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana and Mississippi Gulf coasts, extending eastward to the AL/FL border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely at Pascagoula Sunday night into Monday, with a small chance (≈4%) of sustained 64-kt hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–7 ft above ground level possible along the Mississippi coast, including around Pascagoula and Mississippi Sound.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals to 12 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Sunday–Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Saturday night.
